author: Megan Stallings
comment: It didn't show up before the update but now it shows up on my watch as a choice.  I've been looking for a digital face with step count and this one is fantastic!

reply.author: Fathom Information Design
reply.content: That's great, thank you for the updated review!

title: Works after the update!

author: Karena Crawford
comment: Thanks to the developers who reached out to me about my concerns about it not working. It works now and it looks great on my watch. Thank you!!!!!!

reply.author: Fathom Information Design
reply.content: Great, we're glad you're enjoying it!

title: It works!

author: Tristan V
comment: This is exactly what I wanted! A simple watch face with the digital time and a step count! The circle effect is very appealing, and I love how they move around as you tilt the watch.
title: Just what I was looking for!

author: Doody Ana
comment: I downloaded  and installed it but it doesn't open ..i don't know what's the problem i can't find it on my cell phone.

reply.author: Fathom Information Design
reply.content: Ana, sometimes the face takes a few minutes to appear on your phone after you install it. Please let us know if the application shows up on your phone!

author: Laura West
comment: Classy, and fun.  But what is that screen that covers the face and says 10,000 steps, (not actually my step count) and how do I go back to the regular face?

author: Mohammed Shafi Musthafa Ali
comment: Simple, light weight and animated watch face #⌚
title: Simply awesome

author: Aria Saarkia
comment: Simple, neat, and does exactly what it says on the tin. Can't fault it.
title: Great watch face

author: Douglas Sinclair
comment: Cool and original.  A better visualization of activity than the usual arc.

author: Nikita Moore
comment: I use to love it...not working for my Moto 360 anymore

author: Brandon Moon
comment: Drained my battery super fast.
title: Cool, but

author: Andrew Lee
comment: Love it.
title: One of most interactive google fit watchface

comment: Coubertin Rings looks awesome and seems to work well, with smooth, lag-free animation. I found Coubertin Rings to be easy to read in virtually all levels of lighting, and the watchface appears to be well optimized, as battery usage seems to be minimal. Very nice indeed...
title: Looks awesome, artistic.

author: Deb Clark
comment: Really loved this because it's so much fun to see the rings and colors develop the more I walk, but it's stopped resetting itself every day now.I have to select another watch face in the morning and then change it back to reset the steps to zero.. I'm still using it, but I wish it would just reset in the morning like it used to. Need an update/fix.

reply.author: Fathom Information Design
reply.content: Fixed in the latest release—sorry about that!

author: Michael Collins
comment: Works now! Pretty nice watch face. definitely unique.   -  Moto 360.

reply.author: Fathom Information Design
reply.content: Please try the latest version, it was rebuilt for Android 6 support and that seems to have fixed the issues.

author: Ted Miller
comment: A nice watch face to show off your watch. Ambient mode was a pleasant surprise.
title: Unique

author: Ulrich Schonhardt
comment: Great fun for walking.

author: Mark Focas
comment: Looks like a nice, idea but doesn't work. The steps remain at zero (works with other watch faces) so no rings show. In effect it remains as an off center digital watch. Hopefully yo can get it working (One Plus One and Samsung Gear Live)

author: Mitchel Wood
comment: Nice, but recently stopped staying in sync with what the watch was counting. Watch said I did 7,000 steps... face says 101. Moto 360 and Note 4 running stock 5.1.1
title: Problem

author: Mike Romeo
comment: Cool concept, but the step counter doesn't seem to work with my LG G Watch R.

reply.author: Fathom Information Design
reply.content: Did you try using it more than once? The steps won't always update during a single glance (since it only lasts a few seconds), but they should accumulate over the course of the day. The actual update rate is limited by the device and trying to minimize battery drain.

author: Steve B
comment: Took a while to start tracking. Started as I was uninstalling, haha. Moto 360 & OPO.
title: Eventually worked

author: Ronson Lai
comment: It's not working well in LG G Watch

reply.author: Fathom Information Design
reply.content: We've been doing most of our recent testing with an LG G Watch, so please try the latest version and hopefully you'll have better luck.

author: Neil Balcombe
comment: No rings display on LG G Watch

reply.author: Fathom Information Design
reply.content: On some devices, the rings only show up when the watch awakes from ambient mode, but give the latest version a try. It shows the count as it's happening so you at least know that it's working. Good luck!

title: No rings
